snippet: Thousands of families remain frustrated by the city’s residence rebuilding program, Build It Back, which has been stalled by design and execution problems largely attributable to the Bloomberg administration.
abstract: Build It Back, New York City's residence rebuilding program following Hurricane Sandy, has been stalled by design and execution problems that are largely attributable to the Bloomberg administration; delays have left thousands of families frustrated by two years of uncertainty, postponed promises and hopeless bottlenecks; though officials have criticized the plan's inefficiencies, there are still no details as to why the process is so bogged down.

byline.original: By RUSS BUETTNER and DAVID W. CHEN

lead_paragraph: Thousands of families remain frustrated by the city’s residence rebuilding program, Build It Back, which has been stalled by design and execution problems largely attributable to the Bloomberg administration.

headline.seo: Broken Pledges and Bottlenecks Hurt Mayor Bloomberg's Build It Back Effort
headline.main: Hurricane Sandy Recovery Program in New York City Was Mired by Its Design
headline.print_headline: Storm Rebuilding Program Mired by Its Design
